section.title: Configuration overview
section.para: In order for information to appear in the Archive Service, the source of that information must be registered to the Archive Service. Information sources are registered using tools like . Each registration has a limited lifetime; mds-servicegroup-add should be left running in the background so that it can continue to refresh registrations. Depending on administration preference, it may be run on the same host as the Archive Service, on the same host as a member resource, or on any other host(s).

The Archive Service is built on and can use any to collect information. In the most common case, the Archive Service uses the QueryAggregatorSource (set in the config file [registering grid resources to aggregator services]) to gather resource property values from the registered resource using one of the three WS-Resource Properties operations to poll for information; the polling method used depends on the configuration element supplied in the registration content.

Two other aggregator sources are supplied with the MDS4 distribution: the SubscriptionAggregatorSource, which gathers resource property values through subscription/notification, and the ExecutionAggregatorSource, which executes an external program to gather information.

section.title: Defining the Aggregator Sources
section.para: The aggregation source used to collect data can be changed from default by editing the aggregatorSources parameter in the JNDI service configuration. See $GLOBUS_LOCATION/etc/globus_wsrf_mds_archive/jndi-config.xml:

This parameter specifies one or more Java classes that may be used to collect data for the Archive Service. By default it is set to use the QueryAggregatorSource, SubscriptionAggregatorSource, and ExecutionAggregatorSource. Details of the supplied sources are in the Aggregator Sources Reference.
